Award.AwardTitle: Online Instructional Resources for Material Science Technology Education
Award.AbstractNarration: Over the last one hundred years, material scientists have greatly improved traditional materials. They have also made technological breakthroughs that produced new nanoscale, biological, smart, and composite materials. This project will support a national network for materials technology education. The network will include educational institutions, industry, and professional societies. The long-term goal of the project is to ensure that materials technology education meets industry standards and produces technicians who are well prepared for work across different manufacturing sectors. To achieve this goal, the project will develop and share online resources to support the materials technological education of students and incumbent workers.<br/><br/>The project builds upon the experience and infrastructure of the National Resource Center for Materials Technology Education at Edmonds Community College. Its goal is to support the development of instructional resources for the materials science education community. National network members come from community colleges, four-year institutions, industry partners, community organizations and professional societies. The specific aims of the project include: to improve and expand national access to an online collection of high-quality instructional resources including competency-based modules, presentations, labs, and demonstrations; to implement dissemination strategies that promote increased awareness of online resources, support partnerships, and expand strategic opportunities for the materials science education community; and to leverage the expertise of collaborating national partners to achieve strategic scalability of instructional resources. During this project, technician skill gaps will be identified, instructional modules that address the skill gaps will be developed, and a handbook on materials technology education will be written through a joint effort of network members. The project evaluation will provide insights on how the instructional resources impact students in the national network of educational institutions. This project is funded by the Advanced Technological Education program that focuses on the education of technicians for the advanced-technology fields that drive the nation's economy.<br/><br/>This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
MatEdU (Online Instructional Resources for Material Science Technology Education, NSF ATE DUE #2000347, 09/01/2020 - 08/31/2023), under the leadership of PI Mel Cossette, is a nationally/internationally recognized pioneer and leader in materials and materials science technology education impacting thousands of educators, students, and colleagues across the US. An active network of networks, MatEdU is a focal point where industry, education, policy makers, and community collaborate to meet materials technology workforce needs. Strategic partnering with academia, cross-discipline industries, non-profits, and professional societies have enabled MatEdU to accelerate/extend the availability, growth, and scalability of its robust collection of technician education resources for easy access and broad use/application. The overarching goals fulfilled by the grant: 1) Expanded and enhanced MatEdU’s online library of high-quality resources to support the convergence of materials with existing and emerging technologies; 2) Improved web-based resources and web access to online resources; 3) Disseminated widely to increase website awareness and online engagement; and 4) Provided strategic scalability of resources through longstanding partnerships/collaborations and rising networks/communities. MatEdU has directly impacted hundreds of educational programs on a national level through partnering with many 2- and 4-year institutions, high schools, and skills centers; serving as mentor to 11 cohorts/mentees of Mentor-Connect; and advancing diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility (DEIA) initiatives.

Intellectual Merits MatEdU responds to the national need for curriculum/instructional resources in materials technology to fortify the engineering and advanced manufacturing US workforce. MatEdU offers instructional content/tools/resources to understand materials technology, advanced manufacturing, and engineering design and production processes. It is essential for STEM students and technicians to understand the nonstop increasing quantity and complexity of materials used in advanced manufacturing industries and related sectors. Technicians that understand the relationships between materials properties and production processes leads to improved US quality, productivity and global competitiveness in advanced materials and manufacturing technologies.

Broad Impacts MatEdU has made substantial contributions to advance to materials science technology education and related disciplines such as advanced manufacturing, additive manufacturing, and emerging technologies. Through development/dissemination of the core competencies, MatEdU has been a major contributor to enhanced quality of education in manufacturing processes, as well as engineering design. Visitors to the MatEdU website now number over 300K, tracking ~15,000 hits in 2022-2023. See https://www.materialseducation.org. Please note: The MatEdU website and online resources will be migrating to the Micro Nano Technology Education Center (MNT-EC, DUE# 2000281) by 2024.

 


Last Modified: 09/26/2023
Modified by: Imelda E Cossette
